      • TopKSampler

    • Method Detail

      • beginSampling

        public void beginSampling(int capacity)
        Start to record samples
        Parameters:
        capacity - Number of sample items to keep in memory, the lower this is the less accurate results are. For best results use value close to cardinality, but understand the memory trade offs.

      • finishSampling

        public TopKSampler.SamplerResult<T> finishSampling(int count)
        Call to stop collecting samples, and gather the results
        Parameters:
        count - Number of most frequent items to return

      • addSample

        public void addSample(T item)

      • addSample

        public void addSample(T item,
             long hash,
             int value)
        Adds a sample to statistics collection. This method is non-blocking and will use the "Sampler" thread pool to record results if the sampler is enabled. If not sampling this is a NOOP
